prompts.title: Weekly Planning Architect
prompts.description: Creates a comprehensive weekly plan optimized for deep work and energy management
prompts.prompt:
You are a productivity coach who has helped Fortune 500 executives and entrepreneurs optimize their schedules. Create a comprehensive weekly plan.

**My Context:**
- Role: [YOUR JOB/ROLE]
- Top 3 Goals This Week: [LIST THEM]
- Recurring Commitments: [MEETINGS, CALLS, ETC.]
- Peak Energy Hours: [WHEN ARE YOU MOST FOCUSED]
- Challenges: [WHAT USUALLY DERAILS YOU]
- Available Hours: [HOURS PER DAY FOR FOCUSED WORK]

**Generate:**

## ğŸ¯ Week of [DATE] - Strategic Plan

### ğŸ† Weekly Outcomes (Not Tasks)
[Transform goals into measurable outcomes]

### ğŸ“Š Time Block Schedule

| Time | Monday | Tuesday | Wednesday | Thursday | Friday |
|------|--------|---------|-----------|----------|--------|
| 6-8 AM | | | | | |
| 8-10 AM | | | | | |
[Continue for full day]

**Legend:**
ğŸ”´ Deep Work (no interruptions)
ğŸŸ¡ Shallow Work (emails, admin)
ğŸŸ¢ Meetings/Calls
ğŸ”µ Recovery/Breaks

### ğŸ§  Energy Management Strategy
[Match task difficulty to energy levels]

### âš¡ Daily Themes
- Monday: [Theme]
- Tuesday: [Theme]
[etc.]

### ğŸš« NOT Doing This Week
[What to intentionally ignore]

### ğŸ“± Distraction Defense Plan
[Specific strategies for focus]

### ğŸ”„ Weekly Review Questions
[Questions to ask on Friday]
prompts.example_output:
## ğŸ¯ Week of January 15-19 - Strategic Plan

### ğŸ† Weekly Outcomes (Not Tasks)
1. âœ… Launch landing page (not "work on website")
2. âœ… Close 2 new clients (not "send proposals")
3. âœ… Complete course Module 3 (not "record videos")

### ğŸ“Š Time Block Schedule

| Time | Monday | Tuesday | Wednesday | Thursday | Friday |
|------|--------|---------|-----------|----------|--------|
| 6-7 AM | ğŸ”µ Morning routine | ğŸ”µ Morning routine | ğŸ”µ Morning routine | ğŸ”µ Morning routine | ğŸ”µ Morning routine |
| 7-9 AM | ğŸ”´ Deep Work: Landing page | ğŸ”´ Deep Work: Course recording | ğŸ”´ Deep Work: Landing page | ğŸ”´ Deep Work: Course recording | ğŸ”´ Deep Work: Buffer |
| 9-10 AM | ğŸ”µ Break + Walk | ğŸ”µ Break + Walk | ğŸ”µ Break + Walk | ğŸ”µ Break + Walk | ğŸ”µ Break + Walk |
| 10-12 PM | ğŸŸ¢ Client calls | ğŸ”´ Deep Work: Proposals | ğŸŸ¢ Team meeting | ğŸ”´ Deep Work: Proposals | ğŸŸ¡ Weekly review |
| 12-1 PM | ğŸ”µ Lunch (no screens) | ğŸ”µ Lunch (no screens) | ğŸ”µ Lunch (no screens) | ğŸ”µ Lunch (no screens) | ğŸ”µ Lunch |
| 1-3 PM | ğŸŸ¡ Email + Admin | ğŸŸ¢ Sales calls | ğŸŸ¡ Email + Admin | ğŸŸ¢ Sales calls | ğŸŸ¢ 1:1s |
| 3-4 PM | ğŸ”µ Recovery | ğŸ”µ Recovery | ğŸ”µ Recovery | ğŸ”µ Recovery | ğŸ”µ Week shutdown |
| 4-5 PM | ğŸŸ¡ Planning tomorrow | ğŸŸ¡ Planning tomorrow | ğŸŸ¡ Planning tomorrow | ğŸŸ¡ Planning tomorrow | OFF |

### ğŸ§  Energy Management Strategy
- **High Energy (7-9 AM):** Creative work, writing, complex problems
- **Medium Energy (10-12 PM):** Calls, collaboration, decisions
- **Low Energy (1-3 PM):** Admin, emails, routine tasks
- **Recovery (3-4 PM):** Walk, no screens, recharge

### âš¡ Daily Themes
- **Monday:** Creation Day (build things)
- **Tuesday:** Connection Day (calls & relationships)
- **Wednesday:** Creation Day (build things)
- **Thursday:** Connection Day (calls & relationships)
- **Friday:** Completion Day (tie loose ends)

### ğŸš« NOT Doing This Week
- âŒ Starting new projects (finish current ones)
- âŒ Checking email before 10 AM
- âŒ Meetings before noon
- âŒ Social media during work blocks

### ğŸ“± Distraction Defense Plan
1. Phone in another room during Deep Work
2. Website blocker active 7-9 AM
3. Slack notifications OFF until noon
4. "Do Not Disturb" sign on office door

### ğŸ”„ Friday Review Questions
1. Did I complete my 3 weekly outcomes?
2. What took longer than expected? Why?
3. What should I delegate or eliminate?
4. What's the #1 priority for next week?

prompts.title: Decision Matrix Generator
prompts.description: Creates comprehensive decision frameworks for complex choices
prompts.prompt:
You are a strategic decision-making consultant who has advised CEOs on billion-dollar decisions. Help me make this decision systematically.

**Decision Context:**
- Decision to Make: [DESCRIBE THE CHOICE]
- Options Available: [LIST ALL OPTIONS]
- Timeline: [WHEN MUST I DECIDE]
- Stakeholders: [WHO IS AFFECTED]
- Constraints: [BUDGET, TIME, RESOURCES]
- What I Value Most: [YOUR PRIORITIES]

**Generate a complete decision framework:**

## ğŸ¯ Decision: [RESTATE CLEARLY]

### ğŸ“‹ Options Analysis

#### Option A: [Name]
**Description:** [What this means]
**Pros:**
- [Pro 1]
- [Pro 2]
**Cons:**
- [Con 1]
- [Con 2]
**Best Case:** [If everything goes right]
**Worst Case:** [If everything goes wrong]
**Reversibility:** [Easy/Medium/Hard to undo]

[Repeat for each option]

### ğŸ“Š Weighted Decision Matrix

| Criteria | Weight | Option A | Option B | Option C |
|----------|--------|----------|----------|----------|
| [Criteria 1] | X% | /10 | /10 | /10 |
| [Criteria 2] | X% | /10 | /10 | /10 |
| **TOTAL** | 100% | **X** | **X** | **X** |

### ğŸ§  10/10/10 Analysis
- **10 Minutes:** How will I feel about this decision?
- **10 Months:** How will I feel?
- **10 Years:** How will I feel?

### ğŸ‘¤ Pre-Mortem Analysis
"It's one year later and this decision failed. What went wrong?"

### âœ… Recommendation
[Clear recommendation with reasoning]

### ğŸš€ Next Steps
[Immediate actions if choosing recommended option]
prompts.example_output:
## ğŸ¯ Decision: Should I leave my job to start a business?

### ğŸ“‹ Options Analysis

#### Option A: Quit Now, Go Full-Time on Business
**Description:** Give 2-week notice, dedicate 100% to startup
**Pros:**
- Full focus and energy on business
- Faster iteration and learning
- Burning boats = maximum motivation
**Cons:**
- No income safety net
- Health insurance costs ($600/month)
- Pressure might lead to bad decisions
**Best Case:** Business profitable in 6 months, 2x previous salary in 18 months
**Worst Case:** Business fails, 6 months savings depleted, job market harder
**Reversibility:** Medium - Can get another job, but gap in resume

#### Option B: Side Hustle for 6 More Months
**Description:** Keep job, build business nights/weekends
**Pros:**
- Stable income while validating idea
- Less financial pressure
- Can test market before committing
**Cons:**
- Slower progress (10-15 hrs/week vs 50+)
- Exhaustion and burnout risk
- Competitors might move faster
**Best Case:** Validate idea, save more runway, transition smoothly
**Worst Case:** Burnout, business stalls, stuck in limbo
**Reversibility:** Easy - No major changes yet

#### Option C: Negotiate Part-Time/Consulting
**Description:** Reduce to 20 hrs/week at current job
**Pros:**
- Some income + benefits
- 20+ hours for business
- Best of both worlds
**Cons:**
- Employer might say no
- Still divided attention
- May not be sustainable long-term
**Best Case:** Smooth transition with income floor
**Worst Case:** Employer says no, back to Option A or B
**Reversibility:** Easy - Can go back to full-time or quit

### ğŸ“Š Weighted Decision Matrix

| Criteria | Weight | Option A | Option B | Option C |
|----------|--------|----------|----------|----------|
| Financial Security | 25% | 3/10 | 9/10 | 7/10 |
| Business Progress Speed | 30% | 10/10 | 4/10 | 7/10 |
| Personal Well-being | 20% | 6/10 | 5/10 | 8/10 |
| Risk Level | 15% | 3/10 | 8/10 | 7/10 |
| Long-term Upside | 10% | 9/10 | 6/10 | 7/10 |
| **WEIGHTED TOTAL** | 100% | **5.95** | **6.15** | **7.15** |

### ğŸ§  10/10/10 Analysis
- **10 Minutes:** Option A feels terrifying but exciting. Option C feels smart.
- **10 Months:** If business works, I'll regret not going faster. If it fails, I'll be glad I had a safety net.
- **10 Years:** I'll regret not trying more than I'll regret failing. But I won't regret being strategic.

### ğŸ‘¤ Pre-Mortem: "It's 2025 and this failed. What went wrong?"
- Ran out of money before finding product-market fit
- Couldn't handle the stress without income
- Rushed decisions due to financial pressure
- Didn't validate idea enough before committing

### âœ… Recommendation: Option C (Negotiate Part-Time)

**Reasoning:** The matrix shows Option C scores highest. It provides:
- Enough time to make real progress (not just nights/weekends)
- Financial cushion to make good decisions
- Lower stress = better creativity
- Easy to adjust based on results

**If employer says no:** Move to Option B for 3 months to validate, then Option A.

### ğŸš€ Next Steps (This Week)
1. Monday: Draft proposal for part-time arrangement
2. Tuesday: Calculate exact financial runway for each scenario
3. Wednesday: Schedule meeting with manager
4. Thursday: Prepare negotiation talking points
5. Friday: Have the conversation

prompts.title: Meeting Optimizer
prompts.description: Transforms unproductive meetings into efficient, outcome-driven sessions
prompts.prompt:
You are a meeting efficiency expert who has saved companies millions in wasted meeting time. Optimize this meeting.

**Current Meeting Details:**
- Meeting Name: [NAME]
- Current Duration: [LENGTH]
- Frequency: [DAILY/WEEKLY/ETC]
- Attendees: [NUMBER AND ROLES]
- Current Agenda: [WHAT'S DISCUSSED]
- Problems: [WHAT'S NOT WORKING]
- Desired Outcome: [WHAT SHOULD THIS MEETING ACHIEVE]

**Generate:**

## ğŸ”„ Meeting Transformation: [NAME]

### âŒ Current State Analysis
- Time Wasted: [Calculate annual hours]
- Cost: [Attendees Ã— Hours Ã— Avg Hourly Rate]
- Effectiveness Score: X/10
- Key Problems: [List issues]

### âœ… Optimized Meeting Design

**New Duration:** [Shorter time]
**New Frequency:** [If changed]
**Required Attendees:** [Reduced list]
**Optional/Async:** [Who can get notes instead]

### ğŸ“‹ New Agenda Template

```
[MEETING NAME] - [DATE]
Duration: [X] minutes

â±ï¸ 0:00-0:02 | Check-in (optional)
â±ï¸ 0:02-0:XX | [Agenda Item 1]
â±ï¸ 0:XX-0:XX | [Agenda Item 2]
â±ï¸ 0:XX-0:XX | Action Items & Owners

Pre-work Required:
- [ ] [What attendees should prepare]

Decisions Needed:
- [ ] [What must be decided in this meeting]
```

### ğŸ¯ Meeting Rules
1. [Rule 1]
2. [Rule 2]
3. [Rule 3]

### ğŸ“§ Replace with Async?
[Suggest what could be an email/Slack instead]

### ğŸ“Š Success Metrics
[How to measure if meeting is effective]
prompts.example_output:
## ğŸ”„ Meeting Transformation: Weekly Team Sync

### âŒ Current State Analysis
- **Time Wasted:** 8 people Ã— 1 hour Ã— 52 weeks = **416 hours/year**
- **Cost:** 416 hours Ã— $75/hr avg = **$31,200/year**
- **Effectiveness Score:** 3/10
- **Key Problems:**
  - Status updates that could be async
  - No clear agenda, conversations meander
  - Wrong people in the room
  - No decisions made, just talking
  - Always runs over time

### âœ… Optimized Meeting Design

**New Duration:** 25 minutes (not 60)
**New Frequency:** Weekly (unchanged)
**Required Attendees:** 4 (down from 8)
- Team Lead
- Project Manager  
- Tech Lead
- Design Lead

**Optional/Async:** 4 people
- Junior developers â†’ Read notes
- QA â†’ Slack summary
- Marketing â†’ Relevant items only
- Intern â†’ Not needed

### ğŸ“‹ New Agenda Template

```
WEEKLY SYNC - [DATE]
Duration: 25 minutes HARD STOP

â±ï¸ 0:00-0:02 | Wins & Celebrations (energy boost)
â±ï¸ 0:02-0:10 | Blockers Only (no status updates)
â±ï¸ 0:10-0:20 | Decisions Needed This Week
â±ï¸ 0:20-0:25 | Action Items + Owners + Deadlines

ğŸ“ PRE-WORK (Required before meeting):
- [ ] Update project board with current status
- [ ] Flag any blockers in #team-blockers Slack
- [ ] Come with decisions you need from the group

ğŸ¯ DECISIONS NEEDED THIS MEETING:
1. [Decision 1 - Owner: Name]
2. [Decision 2 - Owner: Name]

âŒ NOT DISCUSSED IN THIS MEETING:
- Individual status updates (use async)
- Deep technical discussions (schedule separate)
- Brainstorming (separate session)
```

### ğŸ¯ Meeting Rules (Post in Meeting Room)

1. **No laptops open** (unless presenting)
2. **No status updates** - we read those async
3. **Blockers only** - "I'm stuck on X, need Y"
4. **Decisions require owners** - No decision without a name + deadline
5. **Hard stop at 25 min** - Unfinished items go to Slack or next meeting
6. **Late = standing** - Arrive on time or stand for the meeting

### ğŸ“§ Replace with Async

**Move to Monday Slack Post:**
```
ğŸ“Š WEEKLY STATUS UPDATE
Post by 9 AM Monday in #team-updates

âœ… Completed last week:
ğŸ¯ Focus this week:
ğŸš§ Blockers:
ğŸ’¡ FYIs for team:
```

**Move to Loom Videos:**
- Demo walkthroughs
- Technical explanations
- Training content

### ğŸ“Š Success Metrics

| Metric | Before | Target | How to Measure |
|--------|--------|--------|----------------|
| Duration | 60 min | 25 min | Calendar |
| Attendees | 8 | 4 | Headcount |
| Decisions/meeting | 0.5 | 3+ | Track in notes |
| Action items completed | 40% | 90% | Weekly review |
| Team satisfaction | 3/10 | 8/10 | Monthly survey |

**Annual Savings:**
- Old: 8 people Ã— 1 hr Ã— 52 weeks = 416 hours
- New: 4 people Ã— 0.42 hr Ã— 52 weeks = 87 hours
- **Saved: 329 hours = $24,675/year** ğŸ‰
